availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Anderson (Henry County, Kentucky, School Teacher.)

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, merchant and dry good store owner. Pennsylvania native. Father of Emma C. Anderson. Married to Emiline Driskell Anderson in Carroll County, Kentucky, on April 9, 1846. Father of Arabella Anderson, William E. Anderson, Stephen Anderson, John C. Anderson, David Alva Anderson, and Carrie Anderson. Merchant in Carroll County in 1850. Dry good store owner in Carroll County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Carroll County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 1, p. 167A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 122.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 242A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Worthville, p. 76A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carroll County Marriages, Film #000414689, p. 153.
